p: The crude extract and various fractions of D. viscosa induced severe embryonic teratogenic effect in zebrafish embryos when treated with lower than LD 50 concentration. Zebrafish embryos which were treated with crude extract or fractions exhibited severe developmental delay and did not hatch. The delayed hatching is supposed to be due to the absence of activity of zebrafish hatching enzyme 1 (ZHE1) which is secreted by hatching gland of zebrafish [ 40].
